Congratulations to the Brave Bots, FFCS's robotics team! ü§ñü§ñü§ñ They earned first place at the Excelsior Region's FIRST Tech Challenge qualifying tournament in Sauquoit earlier this month. Their success clinched them a spot at the regional championships in Utica on March 14. They will compete against teams from all across New York State. #bravestrong

FIRST Tech Challenge is a nationwide organization. Teams are challenged to design, build, program and operate robots to compete in head-to-head challenges in an alliance format. Students develop STEM skills and practice engineering principles, while realizing the value of hard work, innovation and teamwork.

In Sauquoit, the Brave Bots worked with two other teams on an alliance that took first place out of 28 teams. The Brave Bots also won third place in the Motivate Award category. The award celebrates the team that exemplifies team spirit and enthusiasm. Great job!!!

Our middle school Builders Club has a long tradition of visiting the residents of the Hillcrest Spring Assisted Living Facility. Happy Birthday, Gert! ü•≥ü•≥ü•≥

Students made Wojtkiewicz a birthday crown and a poster of what life was like back in 1919, the year she was born. They took photos with 1920s-themed photo booth props, sang, decorated cupcakes, and played games like 1900's Name that Tune, 1900's Trivia, and Pictionary.

"We visited Gert the day after her birthday, so according to her, she was 100+1 when we went, as it was her first day towards 101," club adviser Kari Callery said. "She is so funny!"
